name: Flashiness or high-flow frequency
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Low flow velocity describes movement through the thalweg during typical low flow; measurable movement supports dissolved oxygen and limits stagnation, while shifts indicate altered baseflow timing.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Calculate a flashiness index from daily flows. Where ungauged, use qualitative storm-response observations as a screening proxy.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Low-flow and storm response align with local norms for the stream type.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Slight increase in flash surges or modestly longer dry periods than expected.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Clearly more frequent flash events or much longer dry periods than normal.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Extreme flashiness or extended dry periods indicating severe low-flow alteration.
